topCities.description: Vienna is known as the city of music, has a city center filled with Baroque architecture, and has one of the highest qualities of life.

sites: Visit all the palaces: particularly Schonbrunn and Belvedere.
Listen to some Austrian music at the Opera House.
Wander through the Naschmarkt to see fresh produce, sweets and more.

topCities.description: Brussels is one of the capitals of the European Union and is a center for international dealings.
Sofia has a long, diverse history starting in 7000 BCE; today it is one of the best start-up cities in the world.
sites: See art and history from the many empires that ruled over the city in the churches; Alexander Nevsky Cathedral, St. Sofia and Rotunda of St. George are only a few.
Visit the Museum of Socialist Art to discover the vestiges of the communist era in Bulgaria.
Enjoy outdoor dining while trying sirene, kebapche paired with Bulgarian wine.

topCities.description: Dubrovnik is the beautiful port city of Croatia, known for its well preserved ancient walls.
sites: Soak in the beach life by trying the seafood before laying out on the shore.
Walk up and down the Stradun to see the nightlife.
Climb to the top of the city’s walls for a beautiful view of the city and the sea.

topCities.description: Prague has been one of the top tourist destinations for many years due to its reputation as a beautiful, arts-filled city with an exciting nightlife scene.
sites: Tour the Prague Castle and St. Vitus Cathedral for a look at Medieval life.
Be sure to walk across the Charles Bridge and stop in the Old Town Square.
Go out with the locals even though it probably won’t start until after midnight.

topCities.description: Copenhagen is the known for its cool districts and many museums, resturants and bars as well as its beautiful waterfront
sites: Snap picture after picture of the photogenic Nyhavn Harbor; take a boat tour if you want to see more.
Bike through the city center to get to the local sites: Amalienborg Palace, Rosenborg Palace, the Borsen, and the Rundetarn.
Check out the unique and exciting neighborhoods popping up in Copenhagen such as Christiania and Orestad to better understand the modern culture.

topCities.description: As one of the world's most influential and powerful cities for many centuries, London's culture and history speaks for itself.
sites: Stop by the many historically significant landmarks in town; definitely stop by Buckingham Palace,  Westminster Abbey, the London Bridge, the Tower of London and Big Ben.
Stop by some of the many museums: the Tate, the British Museum or the Churchill Museum.
Walk along the Thames before stopping at the Globe Theater to see Shakespeare’s famous theater.

topCities.description: Tallinn's Old Town is the main attraction for tourists with much of the history coming from the 13th and 14th centuries.
sites: Explore the Old Town’s pubs, pharmacy, square and towers.
Learn about espionage at the Sokos Hotel Viru’s museum in the former KGB Office.
Buy some of the artisanal linen or amber from the street vendors.

topCities.description: Helsinki is known for amazing culture in the Nordic region, being rated as one of the most livable cities in the world in 2015.
sites: Tour the Design Museum, then pay attention to the city’s modern architecture and design, particularly in the design district.
Stop into a cafe to try the traditional cinnamon buns and live like the locals.
Explore the Kauppatori Market Square for fresh food and local goods.

topCities.description: Paris the the city of love, but is also the city of art, high fashion, culture and cuisine.
sites: Climb the Eiffel Tower to view the city, take the stairs if you dare.
Explore the Louvre and the Musee d’Orsay; key pieces are the Mona Lisa and all of the impressionist work.
Sail down the Seine at sunset to see the city light up.

topCities.description: The capital of Georgia has become known for its natural beauty and engaging culture.
sites: Check out the city squares while walking through town: Rose Revolution Square and Freedom Square in particular.
Buy some antiques from local vendors on the Mshrali Khidi.
Take part in the nightlife, try the wine while listening to local musicians.

topCities.description: As a center for design and technology, Berlin has one of the world's most attractive cosmopolitan cultures.
sites: Head to the Brandenburg Gate and the East Side Gallery for learn more about the split of city.
Take in the beauty of the Berlin Cathedral before touring any of the museums on Museum Island.
For amazing art, go to the Mitte to see the many art galleries.

topCities.description: Athens is a city of a long history with many of the most impressive Greek Empire's historical sites.
sites: See the ancient ruins in the Acropolis Museum after touring the Parthenon.
Try the souvlaki with tzatziki as a starting point for trying the greek cuisine.
Run on the Olympic Stadium which was rebuilt from its ruins for the first modern Olympics.

topCities.description: Having been a part of many different empires over the years, Budapest is a mix of many different cultural influences, creating a truly unique city with much to offer.
sites: Take a thermal bath at Szechenyi or Gellert for some relaxation.
Snag some of the local food from the Central Market Hall.
Go out for the nightlife at the bars built within the ruins of abandoned WWII homes.

topCities.description: As one of the most popular destinations, Reykjavik is known for unparalleled natural beauty and its unique culture.
sites: Climb to the top of the Hallgrímskirkja church to see the aerial view of the city’s brightly colored roofs.
Make the trip to the Blue Lagoon for natural heat and beauty.
First try the reindeer or whale, then finish the night with some the local beer and liquor.

topCities.description: Dublin has lots to do for any interest between its five quarters including culture, commerce and history.
sites: Tour the distinct Georgian doors throughout the city.
Go to the Guinness factory and sample the beer.
Stop by the Temple bar area before heading to the Creative Quarter for some shopping.

topCities.description: All roads lead to Rome for a reason; Rome has amazing ruins and history from the Roman empire, italian cuisine and the Catholic Vatican all within its bounds.
sites: See the ancient sites: tour the Colosseum, Pantheon and Roman Forum at least. All the Roman ruins are worth seeing, but these in particular.
he Vatican: do the museum tour, it has amazing artwork and the Sistine Chapel.
Admire the artwork at the Borghese Gallery. It includes the amazing Apollo and Daphne and many other cool pieces.

topCities.description: Riga is filled with stunning architecture and exciting nightlife.
sites: See the House of the Blackheads in the city center along with other landmarks like St. Peter’s Church and the Freedom Monument.
Enjoy the beautiful historic architecture such as the Three Brothers buildings and the Art Nouveau District.
View the art of the city: both the street art and the exquisite jewelry sold by vendors.

topCities.description: Vilnius has an ancient charm that attracts many tourists.
sites: Explore the Uzupis Republic, the artistic center for the city with its own constitution.
See the quirky charms of the Old Town from the street then view it from the Gediminas Tower.
Shop along Pilies Street while listening to street musicians.

topCities.description: Amsterdam is known for its unique culture including its red-light district and coffee shops, but it also boasts impressive museums and gorgeous canals.
sites: Bike over and next to the canals before getting on one of the cruises to see the city from the water.
Go museum hopping from the Anne Frank Museum to Rijksmuseum to the Van Gogh Museum.
Definitely taste the pancakes or the waffles or both!

topCities.description: Although Olso is one of the most expensive cities in the world, it is also known for its beauty and an amazing nightlife.
sites: Walk through the Oslo Opera House to see its stunning architecture.
See the Vigeland Park to see some greenery along with sculpture.
Go to the National Gallery and see the Scream, the Munch Museum, and the Ibsen Museum for amazing art.

topCities.description: Having been reconstructed after WWII, Warsaw is a mixture of the older remaining buildings and the new.
sites: See the castles and royal buildings at Royal Łazienki, Wilanow Palace and Castle Square.
Visit the Museum of Warsaw Uprising that commemorates the rebuilding of the city after WWII.
Go to Praga to see art as well as some of the oldest building in the city.

topCities.description: With exciting culture, a coast, and a beautiful city, there is much to love in Lisbon.
sites: Sample the local food and drink: travesseiros, pastéis de nata, and ginjinha.
Wander through the Principe Real neighborhood to see shops and cafes.
Visit Jerónimos Monastery, Castelo de São Jorge and  Rossio & Praça da Figueira Square for a sense of the architecture of the city.

topCities.description: Moscow is known for its history as the center of the USSR, but also for its fascinating style and art.
sites: Sit in the Red Square and take in St. Basil's Cathedral.
Go to the Kremlin, tour the Armory and Diamond Fund.
Take the metro from place to place; it's one of the oldest and most beautiful.

topCities.description: Edinburgh is particularly full of natural beauty, but also filled with art and Scottish heritage.
sites: Walk through the Old Town and the Royal Mile.
Enjoy the Scottish art at the Scottish National Gallery
Head up the Arthurs Seat for an amazing view of the whole city.

topCities.description: Bratislava is a popular destination for Europeans to travel to with its international appeal.
sites: Wander through the Old Town, pay attention to the amazing architecture.
Cross the Novy Most bridge and go to the UFO viewing area to see some Soviet style and a view.
Check out the Museum of Jewish Culture to learn about the significant Jewish population that was diminished during the Holocaust.

topCities.description: Injected with culture from Italy, Austria, and Yugoslavia and filled with students, Ljubljana is a lively city to visit.
sites: Visit Metelkova City for the arts scene and the nightlife.
Walk along the river and see the Butcher's Bridge and the Triple Bridge.
Tour the Museum of Contemporary Art, the National Museum of Slovenia, and the Ethnographic Museum.

topCities.description: Barcelona is known for its amazing arts scene and stunning architecture.
sites: Start at the Parc Guell for unparalleled views and the signature bright benches as your first stop on your tour of Galdi's artistic architecture throughout the city..
Head to the Sagrada Familia to see the symbol of Barcelona.
Walk along the shore and enjoy the pace of beach life.

topCities.description: Stockholm is a city full of nature as well as Nordic culture.
sites: Sail through the archipelago's islands.
Wander through Gamla stan, the old town of Stockholm and take in the architecture and history.
Learn about Viking ships at the Vasa Museum.

topCities.description: Zurich is known for its economic focus, but also boasts great nightlife and culture.
sites: Take a boat ride on Lake Zurich to soak in the natural beauty surrounding the city.
Walk along the Limmat with the runners and check out the architecture as you go.
Try the Swiss chocolate and cheese fondue for a meal.

topCities.description: As the city situated between two continents and many cultures, Istabul boasts a very diverse and multicultural experience.
sites: Go to the Hagia Sophia, a beautiful building which used to be a catholic church before it was converted into a mosque, now remaining a museum that is truly representative of the cross-cultural nature of the city.
Visit the Grand Bazaar to find amazing goods and see some the most beautiful artisanal work in the city.
Head to the Golden Horn, the division between the modern and ancient parts of Istanbul and take a boat ride between the two sides.

topCities.description: Kiev is a city very representative of the Ukrainian people as a whole filled with life, but also with rememberance of the horrors of WWII in the nation.
sites: For a tour of the religious sites of Kiev, head to Saint Sophia's Cathedral and Kiev Pechersk Lavra's catacombs.
Visit the PinchukArtCenter for local and international art exhibits.
Spend time in the Museum of the History of Ukraine in WWII to better understand the profound impact the war had on the city.
In the heart of the city, walk through Bute Park and enjoy the nature in the city.
See a rugby match in the Principality Stadium.
Scope out the Welsh castles such as Castell Coch and Cardiff Castle.
